docs.lead_paragraph: Almost nothing about the new tax law is irreversible. Even before President Bush signed it this morning with great fanfare at a White House ceremony, the politicians were talking about how to revise it. So this law -- Mr. Bush's top legislative priority -- will not necessarily lead to the kind of permanent change that would occur if Congress approved some of his other big policy proposals, like converting a part of Social Security into private savings accounts or requiring retirees on Medicare to shop for health insurance in the private market or installing a missile defense system.
docs.abstract: News analysis of efforts getting under way on Capitol Hill to revise tax law just signed by Pres Bush; Republicans want to speed up tax rate reductions and give new tax breaks to businesses; Democrats, who now control Senate, want to block some of cuts in new law before they take effect (M)
